titleInfo.title: Loading sugar cane in cars from barges on Bayou Terrebonne, Houma, La.

mods.abstract: Tremendous quantities of cane were moved over the bayous in barges towed by paddle wheel boats. Note railroad highball signal at far left. From Mrs. Margaret Shaffer Collection.

titleInfo.title: Louisiana Sea Grant Digital Images Collection

mods.note: Butler, W.E. Down Among the Sugar Cane: The Story of Louisiana Sugar Plantations and Their Railroads. Baton Rouge, LA: Moran Publishing Corporation, 1980.
